comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: That initial J probably is Bain's error. Maybe it stands for "Jr." This likely is Charles C. Nott, Jr., former Assistant District Attorney, and the newly-elected judge of the General Sessions court in New York. That would fit with the Bain/LOC photo timeline, which is now posting stuff taken in November, 1913. Here is Nott, in a New York Times story from November 7, 1913: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E03EED9113CE633A...

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: It was probably a "J" for Judge. It is sometime difficult to read the Google News Archive when people are referred to as Judge, Cardinal, Marshall, Governor and Mayor and only a last name. They are assuming the contemporary reader is already familiar with the people in the news, and there is only one person by that name in that time and geographic location. I was able to get his birth date from his passport application from 15 October 1920. Charles Cooper Nott, Jr. (October 10, 1869 - May 10, 1957) I started an entry in Wikipedia for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Cooper_Nott,_Jr.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to you both.  This seems to be an error on Bain's part.  Another photograph taken at the same time is captioned "Chas. C. Nott."  So we will correct the caption for this image the next time we update the record.
